content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the treble clef, no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in score A is a set of seven quarter notes played in succession. The pitches in score A are: E4, D4, E4, F sharp 4, G4, A4, and B4.

content.answer: Score D has one staff in the treble clef, no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in score D is a set of seven quarter notes played in succession. The pitches in score D are: E4, D sharp 4, E4, F sharp 4, G sharp 4, A4, and B4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
